intro: Rinorea pulgarensis, commonly known as the purple rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a velvety texture. Rinorea pulgarensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
